0.user_question: Susan made 8172231 cookies for Christmas and was going to equally divide them between her 6 nephews. Before Susan could package them, her husband snuck 4 cookies for himself. How many cookies will each of Susan’s nephews get?

direct_answer.text: First calculate the initial amount of cookies before taking away the ones taken by Susan's husband: 8172231 - 4 = 8172227. Now we need to find out how many equal parts this new quantity can be divided into six (for all the siblings):  8172227 / 6 = 1362038 remainder {①}. Because it doesn't evenly split among these numbers, not everyone gets exactly as many treats. This means you round down your result which leads us to conclusion – every one receives approx 1362038 delicious things .
